sen.j: 天文道（てんもんどう）とは、天文現象の異常（天文異変/天変現象）を観測・記録し、その地上への影響について研究する古代の学問。
sen.e: Tenmondo (ancient horoscopy) is an ancient study to observe and record unusual astronomical phenomena (extraordinary astronomical events/extraordinary natural phenomena) and to look into their effects on the Earth.

Tenmondo (ancient horoscopy) is an ancient study involving the observation and recording of unusual astronomical phenomena (extraordinary astronomical events/extraordinary natural phenomena) and investigation of their effects on the Earth.

Tenmondo (ancient horoscopy) is an ancient study involving the observation and recording of unusual astronomical phenomena (extraordinary astronomical events/extraordinary natural phenomena) and investigation of their effects on the Earth.

sen.j: 今日で言う天文学に相当するが、内容的には占星術の色合いが強く、科学とは程遠いものであった。
sen.e: While it was equivalent to the astronomy of today, it was more like astrology and was far from a science.
While it was equivalent to present-day astronomy, it was closer to astrology and was far from a science.
While it was equivalent to present-day astronomy, it was closer to astrology and was far from a science.

sen.j: そもそも、「天文」とは、天に現れた変化を記録することを指す。
sen.e: Originally, 'Tenmon' meant recording the changes that appeared in the sky.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, 'Tenmon' meant to record the changes that appeared in the sky.
Originally, 'Tenmon' meant to record the changes that appeared in the sky.

sen.j: 天文現象に合理的な規則性を求める科学としての天文学の日本における成立は江戸時代の西洋天文学の伝来以後である。
sen.e: It was after Western astronomy was introduced in the Edo period that astronomy as a science whose aim is to seek rational regularity was established in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Astronomy as a science with the aim of seeking rational regularity was established in Japan only after Western astronomy was introduced in the Edo period.
Astronomy as a science with the aim of seeking rational regularity was established in Japan only after Western astronomy was introduced in the Edo period.

sen.j: このため、両者の違いを知る天文学者の中には明治時代に英語やドイツ語にあったAstronomyを翻訳して星学など「天文（学/道）」に代わる用語を作ろうとした経緯がある。
sen.e: Because of this, in the Meiji period astronomers who knew the difference between the two tried to translate the word 'Astronomy' in English or German into some other terms than 'tenmon (gaku/do)' such as seigaku.

Because of this, in the Meiji period, astronomers who knew the difference between the two tried to translate the English or German word 'Astronomy' into terms other than 'tenmon (gaku/do)', such as "seigaku (study of stars)".

Because of this, in the Meiji period, astronomers who knew the difference between the two tried to translate the English or German word 'Astronomy' into terms other than 'tenmon (gaku/do)', such as "seigaku (study of stars)".

sen.j: むしろ、暦道の方が天文学でいう、暦算天文学・位置天文学の系統に近いものがあったとされている。
sen.e: Rather, rekido (learning of the calendar) was thought to be closer to the lines of some kinds of astronomy, such as rekisan (calendrical calculations) astronomy or positional astronomy.
Rather, rekido (calendar studies) was thought to be more along the lines of some types of astronomy, such as rekisan (calendrical calculations) astronomy or positional astronomy.
Rather, rekido (calendar studies) was thought to be more along the lines of some types of astronomy, such as rekisan (calendrical calculations) astronomy or positional astronomy.

sen.j: 天文異変とは、普段では見られない天文現象の事を指す。
sen.e: Extraordinary astronomical events are astronomical phenomena which cannot usually be seen.
Extraordinary astronomical events are astronomical phenomena which are seen only rarely.
Extraordinary astronomical events are astronomical phenomena which are seen only rarely.

sen.j: 例えば、日食や月食、流星や彗星の出現、月と星の（見かけ上の）異常接近、惑星同士の（見かけ上の）異常接近、赤気、光暈、白虹などを指す。
sen.e: These include, for example, a solar eclipse, an eclipse, shooting stars, comets, an abnormal approach of the moon and stars (to the eye), low-latitude aurora, halation and white rainbows.

These include, for example, solar and lunar eclipses, shooting stars, comets, (the appearance of) abnormal closeness between the moon and stars, (the appearance of) abnormal closeness between planets, low-latitude auroras, halation and white rainbows.

These include, for example, solar and lunar eclipses, shooting stars, comets, (the appearance of) abnormal closeness between the moon and stars, or between planets, low-latitude auroras, halation and white rainbows.
sen.cmt: (the appearance of) abnormal closeness を削除してorを挿入しました。

sen.j: これらの現象は地上にある国家やその支配者（国王・皇帝・天皇）に重大な影響を与えると考えられてきた。
sen.e: These phenomena were thought to give significant influence to nations on earth and their rulers (kings and emperors).
These phenomena were thought to significantly influence nations on earth and their rulers (kings and emperors).
These phenomena were thought to significantly influence nations on earth and their rulers (kings and emperors).

sen.j: そのため、事前に予測可能な現象は予報を出してこの日に国家行事などを行う事を避け、突発的な現象に対しては、天文現象を観測してその意味を占いによって解釈して支配者に報告して対策を練る必要があった。
sen.e: Therefore, predictable phenomena were given advance warning so as to avoid these days when holding national events, while unforeseen incidents needed to be observed, interpreted by divination and reported to the rulers so that they could take measures.

Therefore, advance warning was given for predictable phenomena, so that these days could be avoided when holding national events, while unforeseen incidents needed to be observed, interpreted by divination and reported to the rulers so that they could respond appropriately.

Therefore, advance warning was given for predictable phenomena, so that these days could be avoided when holding national events, while unforeseen incidents needed to be observed, interpreted by divination and reported to the rulers so that they could respond appropriately.

sen.j: 日本における天文道の最高権威であった天文博士に求められたのは、天文異変の際の対処策である。
sen.e: What was required of tenmon hakase (master of astrology), who were the authorities on tenmondo, was to take measures against extraordinary astronomical events.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: What was required of tenmon hakase (masters of astrology), the authorities on Tenmondo, was to take measures concerning extraordinary astronomical events.
What was required of tenmon hakase (masters of astrology), the authorities on Tenmondo, was to take measures concerning extraordinary astronomical events.

sen.j: 天文異変の異変の状況とその内容の吉兆を勘録した奏書を陰陽寮または蔵人所を通じて天皇に報告する事を天文密奏と称した。
sen.e: Reporting the status of extraordinary astronomical events and their good omens in sosho (report to the Emperor) to the Emperor through the Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination) or Kurododokoro (the Chamberlain's Office) was called tenmon misso.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Reporting the status of extraordinary astronomical events and the good omens they contained in sosho (reports to the Emperor) to the Emperor, conducted through the Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination) or Kurododokoro (the Chamberlain's Office), was called tenmon misso.

Reporting the status of extraordinary astronomical events and the good omens they contained in sosho (reports to the Emperor) to the Emperor, conducted through the Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination) or Kurododokoro (the Chamberlain's Office), was called tenmon misso.

sen.j: 律令制においては、暦道・陰陽寮とともに陰陽寮の監督下に置かれ、天文博士（定員1名・正七位下）と天文生（10名）によって構成されていた。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), it was put under supervision of the Onmyoryo together with rekido and the Onmyoryo, and it consisted of a tenmon hakase (one person, Shoshichiinoge (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade)) and tenmon no sho (Student of astronomy) (10 people).

Under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), Tenmondo was put under the supervision of the Onmyoryo, together with rekido and the Onmyoryo, and it consisted of one tenmon hakase (Shoshichiinoge (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade)) and ten tenmon no sho (students of astronomy).

Under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), Tenmondo was put under the supervision of the Onmyoryo, together with rekido and the Onmyoryo, and it consisted of one tenmon hakase (Shoshichiinoge (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade)) and ten tenmon no sho (students of astronomy).

sen.j: 天文に関する現象は国家の存亡に関わる重大な現象であると捉えられ、天文生といえども勝手に天文に関する図書を読むことが許されない程であった（「養老律令」雑令・秘書玄象条）。
sen.e: As phenomena regarding tenmon were considered to be significant in affecting the fate of the country, even tenmon no sho were not allowed to read books on tenmon freely (Yororitsuryozoryo Hisho gensho jo).

As phenomena related to tenmon were considered to significantly affect the fate of the country, even students of tenmon were not allowed to read books on tenmon freely (Yororitsuryozoryo Hisho gensho jo).

As phenomena related to tenmon were considered to significantly affect the fate of the country, even students of tenmon were not allowed to read books on tenmon freely ('Yororitsuryo' zoryo Hisho gensho jo).
sen.cmt: 原文の｢｣の部分に' 'を付加しました。

sen.j: また、観測結果の口外も禁じられていた。
sen.e: Also, it was forbidden to talk about the results of their observations.
It was also forbidden to talk about the results of observations.
It was also forbidden to talk about the results of observations.

sen.j: 天文博士は天文生とともに毎晩夜空を観測して天文異変の有無を探り、異変があれば天文密奏を行った。
sen.e: Tenmon hakase, together with tenmon no sho, observed the sky every night, searching for signs of extraordinary astronomical events, and they sent tenmon misso when any sign was found.
Tenmon hakase observed the sky every night alongside students of tenmon, searching for signs of extraordinary astronomical events; whenever any sign was found, they sent a tenmon misso.
Tenmon hakase observed the sky every night alongside students of tenmon, searching for signs of extraordinary astronomical events; whenever any sign was found, they sent a tenmon misso.

sen.j: また、天文生の教育にもあたった。
sen.e: Tenmon hakase also trained tenmon no sho.
Tenmon hakase also trained students of tenmon.
Tenmon hakase also trained students of tenmon.

sen.j: 主に教科書として用いられたのは、天文では『漢書』・『晋書』の天文志や『天漢書』・『三家薄讃』・『天文要集』（『韓楊要集』）が挙げられている。
sen.e: The textbooks mainly used for education were the tenmonshi (astronomy records) of "Kanjo (Historical records of the Han Dynasty)" and "Jin shu (History of the Jin Dynasty)", "Tenkanjo", "Sankehakusan (textbook for an astrology learner)", "Tenmon Yoshu (the summary of the astrology)" and "Kanyo Yoshu (the summary of the astrology)".
sen.cmt: 天漢書は、読みが確認できませんでした。
sen.e: The major textbooks used in Tenmon were the tenmonshi (astronomy records) "Kanjo (Historical records of the Han Dynasty)" and "Jin shu (History of the Jin Dynasty)", "Tenkanjo", "Sankehakusan (textbook for learners of astrology)", "Tenmon Yoshu (the summary of astrology)" and "Kanyo Yoshu (the summary of astrology)".

The major textbooks used in Tenmon were the tenmonshi (astronomy records) "Kanjo (Historical records of the Han Dynasty)" and "Shin jo (History of the Jin Dynasty)", "Tenkanjo", "Sankehakusan (textbook for learners of astrology)", "Tenmon Yoshu (the summary of astrology)" and "Kanyo Yoshu (the summary of astrology)."
sen.cmt: Jin shuをShin joに変更しました。ピリオドを"の内側に移動しました。

sen.j: もっとも、天文道そのものが陰陽道と比較して日本の律令国家においては、余り重要視されたとは言えなかった部分があり、夜空の観測も平常は戌の刻と寅の刻の定時観測のみであったとされている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, tenmondo was not considered as important as onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) in the ritsuryo nation Japan, and observations of the sky were usually conducted only at fixed times, such as from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. and from 4 a.m. to 6 a.m.

Meanwhile, tenmondo was not considered as important as onmyodo ('the way of Yin and Yang', an occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) in the ritsuryo nation of Japan, and, as a rule, observations of the sky were conducted only at fixed times, such as from 8 PM to 10 PM and from 4 AM to 6 AM.
sen.cmt: I changed "p.m./a.m." to "PM/AM" to avoid the awkward double period at the end of the sentence.
sen.e: Meanwhile, tenmondo was not considered as important as onmyodo ('the way of Yin and Yang', an occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) in the ritsuryo nation of Japan, and, as a rule, observations of the sky were conducted only at fixed times, such as from 8 PM to 10 PM and from 4 AM to 6 AM.

tit.j: 安倍氏による天文道支配
tit.e: The Abe Family's Monopoly over Tenmondo
The Abe Family's Monopoly over Tenmondo
The Abe Family's Monopoly over Tenmondo

sen.j: 更に平安時代中期に賀茂保憲から天文道を継承した安倍晴明以後、天文道は阿倍氏（後の土御門家）の家学となり、他氏の者が関わることを避ける傾向が現れた。
sen.e: After the mid Heian period in which ABE no Seimei, who succeeded to the art of tenmondo from KAMO no Yasunori, was active, the study became the hereditary learning of the Abe clan (or the later Tsuchimikado family) and the family showed a tendency to exclude people from other families.

After the middle Heian period, during which ABE no Seimei, who succeeded to the art of tenmondo from KAMO no Yasunori, was active, the study became the hereditary learning of the Abe clan (later the Tsuchimikado family) and the clan showed a tendency to exclude people from other families.

After the middle Heian period, during which ABE no Seimei, who succeeded to the art of tenmondo from KAMO no Yasunori, was active, the study became the hereditary learning of the Abe clan (later the Tsuchimikado family) and the clan showed a tendency to exclude people from other families.

sen.j: 安倍氏（阿倍氏）は阿倍比羅夫や阿倍仲麻呂で知られるように大化前代以来の豪族・貴族の家系である。
sen.e: The Abe clan (the Abe family), which is known to have ABE no Hirafu and ABE no Nakamaro, had been a line of local ruling families and nobility since the time before the Taika Reforms.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Abe clan (安倍, also written as 阿倍), famed for its members ABE no Hirafu and ABE no Nakamaro, had been a line of local ruling families and nobility since the time preceding the Taika Reforms.
The Abe clan (安倍, also written as 阿倍), famed for its members ABE no Hirafu and ABE no Nakamaro, had been a line of local ruling families and nobility since the time preceding the Taika Reforms.

sen.j: 貴族官僚として陰陽頭に任じられた人物はいるものの、専門官僚として陰陽道・天文道の官に就いたのは晴明が最初であったと考えられている。
sen.e: Although the family had had some people who were appointed as onmyo no kami (Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) as an aristocratic bureaucrat, Seimei was the first to be assigned a job relating to onmyodo and tenmondo as an expert bureaucrat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although some members of the family had been appointed as onmyo no kami (Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) as aristocratic bureaucrats, Seimei was the first to be assigned a job relating to onmyodo and tenmondo as an expert bureaucrat.

Although some members of the family had been appointed as onmyo no kami (Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) as aristocratic bureaucrats, Seimei was the first to be assigned a job relating to onmyodo and tenmondo as an expert bureaucrat.

sen.j: そして、経歴的には天徳 (日本)4年（960年）には40歳で未だに天文得業生、天禄3年（972年）にようやく天文博士（『親信卿記』）となり、従四位下左京権大夫には至った
sen.e: Seimei was still Tenmon tokugyou no sho (researcher of the astrology) at the age of 40 in 960, was promoted to tenmon hakase in 972 ("Chikanobu kyo ki") and was ranked as jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakyo no gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Eastern Capital Offices); however, he died in 1005 at the age of 85 without becoming onmyo no kami, which is the director of the Onmyoryo, and this fact is thought to prove that the Abe clan was not a family which traditionally had a strong basis in terms of the Onmyoryo and tenmondo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the age of 40 in 960, Seimei was still a Tenmon tokugyou no sho (researcher of astrology); in 972, he was promoted to tenmon hakase ("Chikanobu kyo ki") and was ranked as jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakyo no gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Eastern Capital Offices).

At the age of 40 in 960, Seimei was still a Tenmon tokugyou no sho (researcher of astrology); in 972, he was promoted to tenmon hakase ("Chikanobu kyo ki") and was ranked as jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakyo no gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Eastern Capital Offices).

sen.j: ものの陰陽寮の最高責任者である陰陽頭には就任することなく、寛弘2年（1005年）に85歳で没していることから、陰陽寮及び天文道において強い基盤を持っていた家柄ではなかったとみられている。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he died in 1005 at the age of 85 without becoming onmyo no kami (director of the Onmyoryo); this fact is considered proof that the Abe clan was not a family which traditionally had a strong basis in Onmyoryo and tenmondo.

However, he died in 1005 at the age of 85 without becoming onmyo no kami (director of the Onmyoryo); this fact is considered proof that the Abe clan was not a family which traditionally had a strong basis in Onmyoryo and tenmondo.

sen.j: だが、彼の陰陽道・天文道における長期の活躍と長寿、安倍吉昌・安倍吉平の2人の男子に恵まれたことが大きい。
sen.e: However, as he played an active role in onmyodo and tenmondo for a long time and he enjoyed longevity with two sons, ABE no Yoshimasa and ABE no Yoshihira, it established a good foundation for the family.

Regardless, as he played an active role in onmyodo and tenmondo for a long time, enjoyed longevity, and was blessed with two sons, ABE no Yoshimasa and ABE no Yoshihira, a good foundation was established for the family.

Regardless, as he played an active role in onmyodo and tenmondo for a long time, enjoyed longevity, and was blessed with two sons, ABE no Yoshimasa and ABE no Yoshihira, a good foundation was established for the family.

sen.j: 吉昌は天禄元年（970年）に賀茂保憲の推挙で天文得業生に推挙され、寛和2年（986年）に晴明の後任の天文博士に任じられ、寛弘元年（1004年）に陰陽頭を兼任し、死去するまで天文博士を兼務していた。
sen.e: Yoshimasa was recommended by KAMO no Yasunori as tenmon tokugyou no sho in 970, was appointed as tenmon hakase after Seimei in 986 and became onmyo no kami in 1004, serving also as tenmon hakase until his death.

Yoshimasa was recommended by KAMO no Yasunori as tenmon tokugyou no sho in 970, was appointed tenmon hakase after Seimei in 986, and became onmyo no kami in 1004, also serving as tenmon hakase until his death.

Yoshimasa was recommended by KAMO no Yasunori as tenmon tokugyou no sho in 970, was appointed tenmon hakase after Seimei in 986, and became onmyo no kami in 1004, also serving as tenmon hakase until his death.

sen.j: また吉平も正暦2年（991年）に陰陽博士に任じられていたことが知られ、陰陽助などを経た後に従四位下に叙され、寛仁3年（1019年）に天文博士であった吉昌死去を受けて天文密奏の宣旨を受ける。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Yoshihira is known to have been appointed as onmyo hakase (Doctor of onmyo) in 991, was granted Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) after serving as onmyo no suke (Assistant Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) and received an imperial decree of tenmon misso in 1019 following the death of Yoshimasa, who was the then tenmon hakase.

Meanwhile, Yoshihira is known to have been appointed as onmyo hakase (Doctor of onmyo) in 991; he was granted Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) after serving as onmyo no suke (Assistant Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) and received an imperial decree of tenmon misso in 1019 following the death of Yoshimasa, who was the current tenmon hakase.

Meanwhile, Yoshihira is known to have been appointed as onmyo hakase (Doctor of onmyo) in 991; he was granted Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) after serving as onmyo no suke (Assistant Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) and received an imperial decree of tenmon misso in 1019 following the death of Yoshimasa, who was the then tenmon hakase.

sen.j: これは当時の天文権博士和気久邦が伊予国に滞在中であり、天文密奏宣旨を受けた2名も技術が未熟であったために応急措置として与えられたものである。
sen.e: There are two reasons for this emergency appointment: one was that the then tenmongon no hakuji (master of astronomy) 和気久邦 was in Iyo Province and another was that the two people who received imperial decrees of tenmon misso had insufficient skills.
sen.cmt: 和気久邦は、読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: There were two reasons for this emergency appointment: the first was that the current tenmongon no hakuji (master of astronomy), WAKE Hisakuni (? 和気久邦), was in Iyo Province, and the second was that the two people who received imperial decrees of tenmon misso were not sufficiently skilled.
sen.cmt: I don't know if this is the correct pronunciation for the name, either, but there should at least be an attempt. (Since Wikipedia can be edited later by almost anyone, if someone does know the correct pronunciation, they can add it after the fact.)
sen.e: There were two reasons for this emergency appointment: the first was that the then tenmongon no hakuji (master of astronomy), WAKE Hisakuni (? 和気久邦), was in Iyo Province, and the second was that the two people who received imperial decrees of tenmon misso were not sufficiently skilled.

sen.j: その年、吉平は天文得業生であった息子安倍章親を天文博士に推挙した。
sen.e: That year, Yoshihira recommended his own son, ABE no Akichika, who had been tenmon tokugyou no sho, as tenmon hakase.
That year, Yoshihira recommended his own son, ABE no Akichika, who had been tenmon tokugyou no sho, as tenmon hakase.
That year, Yoshihira recommended his own son, ABE no Akichika, who had been tenmon tokugyou no sho, as tenmon hakase.

sen.j: 更に長元8年（1035年）に章親実弟の安倍奉親が天文権博士に任ぜられ、安倍氏が天文両博士を独占した（更に2人の長兄安倍時親も長元4年（1031年）に天文密奏宣旨を受けている）。
sen.e: In addition, in 1035, Akichika's younger brother, ABE no Norichika, was assigned to be tenmongon no hakuji, completing the Abe clan's monopoly of both hakase relating to tenmon (also, in 1031, their oldest brother ABE no Tokichika received an imperial decree of tenmon misso).

In addition, Akichika's younger brother, ABE no Norichika, was assigned to be tenmongon no hakuji in 1035, completing the Abe clan's monopoly of both hakase relating to tenmon (in 1031, their oldest brother ABE no Tokichika received an imperial decree of tenmon misso as well).

In addition, Akichika's younger brother, ABE no Norichika, was assigned to be tenmongon no hakuji in 1035, completing the Abe clan's monopoly of both hakase relating to tenmon (in 1031, their oldest brother ABE no Tokichika received an imperial decree of tenmon misso as well).

sen.j: 天文博士の挙状によって後任の天文博士が任命される例はそれ以前にも存在していた（『朝野群載』）が、これ以後は安倍氏の天文博士が挙状によって自己の一族を天文博士・権博士に任命して世襲していくことが行われるようになった。
sen.e: Although there had been some precedents regarding the appointments of new tenmon hakase by tenmon hakase's recommendation ("Choya gunsai (Collected Official and Unofficial Writings)"), from then on, the tradition that tenmon hakase from the Abe family recommend their own kin for tenmon hakase or tenmongon no hakuji, passing them down in the family, was established.

Although there had been some precedent for new tenmon hakase to be appointed by a tenmon hakase's recommendation ("Choya gunsai (Collected Official and Unofficial Writings)"), from that point on, the tradition of tenmon hakase from the Abe family recommend their own kin for tenmon hakase or tenmongon no hakuji, keeping the positions in the family, was established.

Although there had been some precedent for new tenmon hakase to be appointed by a tenmon hakase's recommendation ("Choya gunsai (Collected Official and Unofficial Writings)"), from that point on, the tradition of tenmon hakase from the Abe family recommend their own kin for tenmon hakase or tenmongon no hakuji, keeping the positions in the family, was established.

sen.j: これは当時天文道が特殊な技術と考えられ、その学術が親子間の相伝（家学）となり、朝廷も天文占術技術の維持を目的としてそれを許容したこと、官司請負制の定着によるところが大きい。
sen.e: There were reasons for this: firstly, as tenmondo was then considered to be special skills and was only passed down among family members (the hereditary learning), the Imperial Court allowed it for the purpose of maintaining divination techniques, and secondly, a hereditary government office system had been established.
sen.cmt: ()内に句点があり、文章が二つに分割されていましたので、一つにし、()内を別に分け直しました。
sen.e: There were reasons for this: first, as tenmondo was then considered to be a special skill and was only passed down among family members (hereditary learning), the Imperial Court allowed it in order to preserve divination techniques, and second, a hereditary government office system had been established.

There were reasons for this: first, as tenmondo was then considered to be a special skill and was only passed down among family members (hereditary learning), the Imperial Court allowed it in order to preserve divination techniques, and second, a hereditary government office system had been established.

sen.j: （一方、賀茂氏側も暦道における自己の立場を主張し、鎌倉時代に入ると本来は陰陽頭が中心となる御暦奏の儀式において安倍氏が陰陽頭の場合には
sen.e: (Meanwhile, the Kamo clan also claimed their superiority in rekido: in the Kamakura period, when a member of the Abe clan was onmyo no kami, the Kamo clan insisted that the ceremony of goryaku no so (the annual presentation of the calendar to the emperor) which had been conducted mainly by onmyo no kami should be conducted by reki hakase,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (Meanwhile, the Kamo clan also claimed their position in rekido: in the Kamakura period, when a member of the Abe clan was onmyo no kami, the Kamo clan insisted that the ceremony of goryaku no so (the annual presentation of the calendar to the emperor), which had been conducted mainly by onmyo no kami, should be conducted by reki hakase.

(Meanwhile, the Kamo clan also claimed their position in rekido: in the Kamakura period, when a member of the Abe clan was onmyo no kami, the Kamo clan insisted that the ceremony of goryaku no so (the annual presentation of the calendar to the emperor), which had been conducted mainly by onmyo no kami, should be conducted by reki hakase.

sen.j: 「天文道は天文密奏、暦道は御暦奏を掌る」という独自の論理を主張して安倍氏の陰陽頭を排除して賀茂氏の暦博士が中心となって行うようになっていった。
sen.e: saying that 'tenmondo should deal with tenmon misso and rekido does goryaku no so' and excluded onmyo no kami of the Abe clan from the ceremony, changing the tradition.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Saying, 'Tenmondo should deal with tenmon misso and rekido should handle goryaku no so', they excluded the Abe clan's onmyo no kami from the ceremony, changing the tradition.
Saying, 'Tenmondo should deal with tenmon misso and rekido should handle goryaku no so', they excluded the Abe clan's onmyo no kami from the ceremony, changing the tradition.

sen.j: また、『今鏡』には藤原南家出身の信西の平治の乱での最期と彼が天文道に通じたことが結びつけて書かれている）。
sen.e: Also, in the book "Imakagami (The Mirror of the Present)" some connection was stated between the death of Shinzei, who was from the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan, in the Heiji War and his deep knowledge of tenmondo.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, in the book "Imakagami (The Mirror of the Present)", some connection was stated between the death of Shinzei, a member of the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan, in the Heiji War, and his deep knowledge of Tenmondo.)

In addition, in the book "Imakagami (The Mirror of the Present)", some connection was stated between the death of Shinzei, a member of the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan, in the Heiji War, and his deep knowledge of Tenmondo.)

sen.j: また、中原氏に対する天文密奏宣旨も元永元年（1118年）の中原師安を最後に途絶え、安倍氏の人物に対してのみ出されることとなる。
sen.e: While the imperial decrees of tenmon misso to the Nakahara clan ended with the one for NAKAHARA no Moroyasu in 1118, they were later issued only to members of the Abe clan.
The imperial decrees of tenmon misso to the Nakahara clan ended with the one for NAKAHARA no Moroyasu in 1118, and were subsequently issued only to members of the Abe clan.
The imperial decrees of tenmon misso to the Nakahara clan ended with the one for NAKAHARA no Moroyasu in 1118, and were subsequently issued only to members of the Abe clan.

sen.j: 更に安倍氏の家系の分裂とともに天文博士の地位や天文密奏宣旨のついても争いが激化した。
sen.e: Furthermore, discords over the position of tenmon hakase and decrees of tenmon misso inside the Abe clan increased as the family members established branch families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, discord within the Abe clan over the position of tenmon hakase and decrees of tenmon misso increased as the family members established branch families.
Furthermore, discord within the Abe clan over the position of tenmon hakase and decrees of tenmon misso increased as the family members established branch families.

sen.j: 天福 (日本)2年（1235年）には宣旨を受けていない安倍家氏が客星出現を知らせた功績で天文博士に補されるという本来の天文博士が天文密奏を行うのとは逆の事例も生じている（『明月記』文暦2年3月26日条）。
sen.e: There was an incident quite contrary to the usual cases in which tenmon hakase conducted tenmon misso (Article on April 22, 1235 of "Meigetsuki (Chronicle of the Bright Moon) ") : in 1235, one member of the Abe clan who had not received an imperial decree was appointed as tenmon hakase with distinguished service in reporting temporarily appearing stars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There was an incident quite contrary to the usual cases in which tenmon hakase conducted tenmon misso (Article on April 22, 1235 of "Meigetsuki (Chronicle of the Bright Moon) ") : in 1235, one member of the Abe clan who had not received an imperial decree was appointed as tenmon hakase for his distinguished service in reporting temporarily appearing stars.

There was an incident quite contrary to the usual cases in which tenmon hakase conducted tenmon misso (Article on April 22, 1235 of "Meigetsuki (Chronicle of the Bright Moon) ") : in 1235, one member of the Abe clan who had not received an imperial decree was appointed as tenmon hakase for his distinguished service in reporting temporarily appearing stars.

sen.j: また、後に安倍氏の主流となる安倍泰親のように、中国由来の天文学よりも陰陽道の考え方を重視して天文道の解釈を行っていくようになった。
sen.e: In addition, like ABE no Yasuchika who became the mainstream of the Abe clan, they came to interpret tenmondo placing more importance to onmyodo than astronomy which came from China.
Additionally, like ABE no Yasuchika who later became the mainstream of the Abe clan, they came to interpret tenmondo with more importance given to onmyodo than to the astronomy which came from China.
Additionally, like ABE no Yasuchika who later became the mainstream of the Abe clan, they came to interpret tenmondo with more importance given to onmyodo than to the astronomy which came from China.

sen.j: 安倍氏の分裂状態は室町幕府の支援を受けた安倍有世（泰親の子孫）の元で統一が図られ、土御門家 (安倍氏)と号して天文道・陰陽道を統括する立場となった。
sen.e: The divided Abe clan were reunited under ABE no Ariyo (descendent of Yasuchika) who was backed by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and they named themselves the Tsuchimikado family (the Abe clan), receiving the position to supervise both tenmondo and onmyodo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The divided Abe clan was reunited under ABE no Ariyo (a descendent of Yasuchika), who was backed by the Muromachi bakufu (a Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun); they named themselves the Tsuchimikado family (the Abe clan), and acquired a position from which they could supervise both tenmondo and onmyodo.

The divided Abe clan was reunited under ABE no Ariyo (a descendent of Yasuchika), who was backed by the Muromachi bakufu (a Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun); they named themselves the Tsuchimikado family (the Abe clan), and acquired a position from which they could supervise both tenmondo and onmyodo.

sen.j: 更に江戸時代の土御門泰福の時代には賀茂氏宗家の断絶後、賀茂氏庶流の幸徳井家と争っていた暦道の地位も奪って、安倍氏流土御門家による陰陽寮支配が確立されることとなった。
sen.e: Later in the Edo period, at the time of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO, the Kamo clan Soke (the head family or house) died out and the Abe clan took the position of rekido, which they rivaled with the Kotokui Family, the branch family of the Kamo Clan, establishing the dominance of the Tsuchimikado family of the Abe Clan in the Onmyoryo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later in the Edo period, at the time of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO, the soke (the head family or house) of the Kamo clan died out and the Abe clan took the position of rekido, over which they had fought with the Kotokui Family, a branch family of the Kamo Clan; in this way, they established the dominance of the Abe Clan's Tsuchimikado family in the Onmyoryo.

Later in the Edo period, at the time of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO, the soke (the head family or house) of the Kamo clan died out and the Abe clan took the position of rekido, over which they had fought with the Kotokui Family, a branch family of the Kamo Clan; in this way, they established the dominance of the Abe Clan's Tsuchimikado family in the Onmyoryo.

sen.j: 日本で今日のような天文学の研究が開始されるのは、江戸幕府が天文方を設置して以後であるが、初代天文方の渋川春海は『天文瓊統』において、科学的な天文観測とともに天文道以来の天体と占いの関係についての学説に割いている（これは春海が土御門泰福から神道を学んだ影響も大きい）。
sen.e: Although it was after the establishment of tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy) by the Edo bakufu that people started to conduct astronomical research like in the present day, the first tenmonkata, Harumi SHIBUKAWA, discussed the theory on the relationship between astronomical bodies and divination, which followed the tradition of tenmondo, as well as scientific observation of the sky in a book called "Tenmon Keito" (this probably comes from the fact that Harumi learned Shinto from Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO).

Although it was only after the establishment of tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy) by the Edo bakufu that people started to conduct astronomical research in the current style, the first tenmonkata, Harumi SHIBUKAWA, discussed the theory on the relationship between astronomical bodies and divination, which followed the tradition of Tenmondo, as well as scientific observation of the sky in a book called "Tenmon Keito" (this may stem from the fact that Harumi learned Shinto from Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO).

Although it was only after the establishment of tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy) by the Edo bakufu that people started to conduct astronomical research in the current style, the first tenmonkata, Harumi SHIBUKAWA, discussed the theory on the relationship between astronomical bodies and divination, which followed the tradition of Tenmondo, as well as scientific observation of the sky in a book called "Tenmon Keito" (this may stem from the fact that Harumi learned Shinto from Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO).

sen.j: また、土御門家の天文道や宿曜道に由来する仏教天文学の抵抗もあり、その本格化は陰陽寮が廃止された明治時代以後のことになる。
sen.e: Also, with resistance from tenmondo of the Tsuchimikado family, as well as Buddhist astronomy which came from Sukuyodo (the astrology brought as a part of esoteric Buddhism), the study was introduced in full after the Meiji period when the Onmyoryo was abolished.

With resistance from Tsuchimikado family's Tenmondo, as well as Buddhist astronomy which came from Sukuyodo (astrology with its roots in esoteric Buddhism), the study was introduced in full after the Meiji period, when the Onmyoryo was abolished.

With resistance from Tsuchimikado family's Tenmondo, as well as Buddhist astronomy which came from Sukuyodo (astrology with its roots in esoteric Buddhism), the study was introduced in full after the Meiji period, when the Onmyoryo was abolished.
